Good, yes, but get the Source version.

Day of Defeat remains, in my opinion, one of the most under appreciated games in Valve's repertoire of excellence. Its tactical sense of strategy while also keeping the competitiveness of Multiplayer shooters give it a tense atmosphere that I thoroughly enjoy. As a look back, it is beyond fun. As a game I would play now, I think I will stick to the Source remake.

This game is one of the old classics. If you want better graphics, feel free to play DOD:Source, but I don't mind. I love this game from the first time i chose a class! it's not just your run of the mill brand FPS. it has at least SOME strategy too it. Like TF2 it implements voice commands and it also has hand signs for silent maneuvers. I also like the broad choice of weaponry, as it can provide a learning curve for just about anybody. I say buy this game. Whether you wait for it to sale lower or not, i dont care. just do yourself a favour and have a go!

Day of Defeat(or DoD) is a very fun and enjoyab  FPS. The graphics are excelent for the time, which might turn some people off due to it being outdated. Its not very in depth, only having about one gamemde, but it does have aspects that are very enjoyable, such as the multiple classes for each team.They all are basically the same weapons from different sides. But the best part of that is that both teams play very differently. The sad part is that there is basically only one english server, the Neo God server. Its always full of people. There are about 3 or 4 japanese servers and one spanish server. I really wish more people would play this game, Its great, and definatly worth your time. This game, gets an  8/10
Day of defeat is a great game its running of the source engine and its an intresting experience

too be honest, before i bought the Counter-Strike anthology pack, I've never even heard of this gem of a game. The wole game is exhillerating.
The bullet impacts sound so real, that you heart begins to race with both exhilleration of excitement and fear of not knowing where the shots are coming from.
Then there's the pleasure of killing 5 dudes who are aware of you all by yourself.
Not to mention, all of the custom maps. I got to experience a WWII game in Aztec from Counter-Strike! 

Also, if you wanna know on how to be a killing machine in this game, you gotta figure out on how certain weapons work. 
Tip: If you wanna play with a machine gun, then crouch, or fire in single round bursts.


10/10

Whether looking for an old game to play to remember the days before steam, or because nothing else will work on your computer, this is an ok buy, but only if on sale.

The original Day of Defeat, graphics wise, looks like shit. Half life, CS 1.6 and TFC look far better than this, and they are much older. Trees, Barbed wire, and various vegetation textures are glitched, and will somtimes not be transparent as they should be. effects are also, unreasonably crappy, as grenades do not show an actual explosion, unlike most older HL games (keep in mind this game runs on another engine, though), and gun fire creates and unjustifiably large, half-assed light effect.

Gameplay is not terrible, though certain effects form jumping, running, and going prone can be annoying. There are many diverse classes with unique weapons, and sometimes even map specific weapons and gamemodes. Most maps are conquest, while some are search and destroy. Unlike CS there is respawning, but on wave timers. Controls are ok on default, but I would recommend some custumization, as some keys, like flashlight, are stupidly placed (it's "n"). Some maps are poorly lit, quite a few are unnecessarily large, and most are designed so that the battles of WW2 end up more like WW1. A bloody stalemate in the middle of the map that shifts forward occaisionally, only to be stopped by someone in a bottleneck with an MG.

While there is still a community, there are alot of empty servers, so lukily there are mods for bots. While playing can be pretty frustrating at times, it's still a fun game to play, and is far better than it's source counterpart. Get it during a sale.

Separates the men from the boys.  You'd better have steady aim.

I absolutely love this game! I only bought it a few weeks ago but is has already become one of my favourite games of all time. It is so much fun and I'm still amazed that so many people play it still- every time I go on there is at least one server with 20 or so people on it. There are loads of things you can do on it that I wouldn't expect for a 2003 game- you can pick up weapons (G) and use mortars (E) and the class system is amazing, allowing you to instantly change class or teams at any time (, to change class; . to change team). It is just like an older version of Tactical Intervention- but much better!

C'est le meilleur FPS auquels j'ai pu jouer des années... 2000. Ce jeu qu'est Day of Defeat, nous envoie dans une expérience divine de la 1ère guerre mondiale et qu'il nous rapelle ce qu'ils ont vécus.
C'est vraiment un très bon jeu qui vous met dans l'ambiance sonore, multijoueur, ainsi que les armes.
Les graphismes très moches, ne compterait mèmes pas dans votre évaluation.
